name: Biobank
definition: Repositories of biological samples and associated databases

name: Preclinical study
column9: e.g. studies on cell cultures or laboratory and animal studies generated prior to human testing

name: Clinical trial
definition: Studies testing medical interventions in humans
column9: including clinical studies and clinical investigations

name: Cohort study
definition: An observational (often longitudinal) study of a defined population, including the use of e.g. questionnaires and surveys

name: Health records
definition: Electronic health records, including hospital administrative systems

name: Registry
definition: Organized database to collect uniform data about an underlying population with no primary scientific research goal

name: Reference data source
definition: Curated datasets that researchers link to or use alongside their primary collections, but that do not originate from a study, biobank, or registry

name: Common data model
definition: A standardised data model which allows for coherent data and information exchange

name: Network
definition: A network or consortium in which data collections are united
